ngoy.core

Annotation Type NgModule


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface NgModule
    Organize declarations/providers and other modules together to be imported as a whole.

    As soon as your app consists of more than one component, a NgModule is needed to make those components known to the engine. Ngoy could scan the classpath for that, but it does not want to.

    Unlike other module systems, there exists no boundaries between modules. At the end, everything is stuffed into a single map. Everything can be reached from anywhere.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<?>[] declarations 
      Class<?>[] imports 
      Provide[] provide
      Declare another class for a provider/service.
      Class<?>[] providers 

    • Element Detail

      • declarations

        public abstract Class<?>[] declarations
        Returns:
        Components, directives and pipes that this module provides
        Default:
        {}

      • imports

        public abstract Class<?>[] imports
        Returns:
        Other modules (classes annotated with NgModule)
        Default:
        {}

      • providers

        public abstract Class<?>[] providers
        Returns:
        Providers/services
        Default:
        {}

      • provide

        public abstract Provide[] provide
        Declare another class for a provider/service.
        Returns:
        Providers
        Default:
        {}
